messageBody:
Anand Narasimhan (anandn) wrote:
> Hi,
>
> How can I test package private classes with JUnit. Our test cases are
> generally in a "unittest" subdirectory of the directory where the
> classes being test are.
>

Don't do this directly. All unit tests should pass through the public
(and protected) interfaces of a class. Most code that can't be reached
through the public/protected interfaces is unreachable code and should
be deleted rather than tested. On rare occasions, there's some code you
must have to fulfill a contract, but that can't actually be reached.
That's not a big concern.
